thread.title: Samsung's reputation takes big hit, poll finds
thread.title_full: Samsung's reputation takes big hit, poll finds

author: Brett Molina
title: Samsung's reputation takes big hit, poll finds
text:
Samsung's reputation takes big hit, poll finds Brett Molina , USA TODAY 12:37 p.m. ET Feb. 21, 2017 
The Galaxy Note 7 debacle scorched Samsung's reputation among the public, according to findings from The Harris Poll. 
Outside a Samsung Electronics office in San Jose. (Photo: Justin Sullivan, Getty Images) 
Their Reputation Quotient ratings -- which measure the reputations of the most visible companies in the U.S. -- finds Samsung plunged to 49th this year, compared to 7th from a year ago. 
Amazon snagged first place for the second straight year, while Apple, Google and Tesla Motors are the other companies in the top 10. 
Samsung's reputation was dinged last year following the massive recall of its Galaxy Note 7 smartphone. The device suffered from a malfunctioning battery that could cause it to catch fire or explode when charging. 
The recall led to Samsung reporting its worst operating profit in two years, costing them at least $5.3 billion in charges.
